//*+*+*+*+*+*+*+*+*+*+*+*+*+*+*+*+*+*+*+*+*+*+*+*+*+*+*+*+*+*+*+*+*+*
//*                                                                 *
//* THE TAPE IS NOW COMPRESSED                                      *
//*                                                                 *
//*                              ALL COMPRESSED FILES HAVE          *
//*                              THE FOLLOWING DCB ATTRIBUTES:      *
//*                              RECFM=VB,LRECL=94,BLKSIZE=32716    *
//*                                                                 *
//*    ALL 80 BYTE RECORD FILES WILL BE COMPRESSED EXECEPT          *
//*    FOR THE FOLLOWING                                            *
//*                                                                 *
//*          FILE 001     THIS FILE                                 *
//*          FILE 002     COMPRESSION/DECOMPRESSION PROGRAM         *
//*          FILE 003     JCL TO DROP THE WHOLE TAPE DOWN           *
//*                                                                 *
//*    LOOK IN THIS FILE IN THE SECTION ENTITLED 'FILE STATUS       *
//*    SECTION' TO SEE EXACTLY WHAT FILES ARE IN COMPRESSED         *
//*    FORMAT AND WHICH ARE NOT IN COMPRESSED FORMAT                *
//*                                                                 *
//*    WHEN ADDITIONS ARE ADDED TO THE TAPE, RATHER THEN PUTTING    *
//*    THEM AT THE END OF THE TAPE , I WILL PLACE THEM IN           *
//*    FILES THAT WERE PREVIOUSLY DELETED AND ARE NOW EMPTY ,       *
//*    ASSUMING THAT THERE ARE ANY .                                *
//*                                                                 *
//*    FILE 3 WHICH IS THE JCL TO DROP THE WHOLE TAPE DOWN WILL     *
//*    BE CURRENT AND UP TO DATE TO THE VERSION OF THE TAPE ON      *
//*    WHICH IT APPEARS ( HOPEFULLY ) .                             *
//*                                                                 *
//*+*+*+*+*+*+*+*+*+*+*+*+*+*+*+*+*+*+*+*+*+*+*+*+*+*+*+*+*+*+*+*+*+*
//*                                                                 *
//*      THIS TAPE IS CUMULATIVE . EACH FILE ON THE TAPE IS THE     *
//*      LATEST VERSION OF THAT FILE WITH ANY AND ALL MAINTENANCE   *
//*      APPLIED TO IT , EXCEPT WHERE SPECIFICALLY NOTED .          *
//*                                                                 *
//*      IF YOU HAVE ANY PROBLEMS PROCESSING THE DATA ON THE TAPE   *
//*      OR FIND ANY ERRORS PLEASE LET ME KNOW AND I WILL ATTEMPT   *
//*      TO CORRECT THEM .                                          *
//*                                                                 *
//*      A  IF THIS IS THE FIRST TIME YOU HAVE RECEIVED THIS MODIFI-*
//*         CATION TAPE I SUGGEST THAT YOU SKIP ALL THE INFORMA-    *
//*         TION THAT IS CONTAINED UNDER THE FOLLOWING ENTITLED,    *
//*         'CHANGES FOR VERSION XXX, MONTH DAY YEAR' AND GO TO     *
//*         THE FILE STATUS SECTION USING THIS AND THE SECTION      *
//*         ENTITLED, 'D O C U M E N T A T I O N' READ WHAT EACH    *
//*         FILE IS AND DECIDE WHAT YOU WANT .                      *
//*                                                                 *
//*      B  IF YOU HAVE RECEIVED A PREVIOUS VERSION OF THIS TAPE    *
//*         YOU MAY WISH TO CHECK ALL THE CHANGES MADE SINCE THAT   *
//*         VERSION AND DECIDE WHAT IS APPLICABLE .                 *
//*                                                                 *
//*      C  WE WILL SOMETIMES CHANGE CODE THAT PERSONS HAVE SENT US *
//*         WHEN WE DO WE WILL TRY TO PUT OUR INITIALS ON THE LINES *
//*         OF CODE THAT WE HAVE MODIFIED .                         *
//*         THE CURRENT SET OF INITIALS ARE                         *
//*                                                                 *
//*                             CBT                                 *
//*                             AXC                                 *
//*                                                                 *
//*         TO FIND OUT WHAT WE DID USE THE TSO EDITOR AND ISSUE    *
//*         THE FOLLOWING AGAINST THE PROGRAM IN QUESTION           *
//*                                                                 *
//*             V                                                   *
//*             C 0 99999999 / CBT / CBT / ALL                      *
//*             C 0 99999999 / AXC / AXC / ALL                      *
//*                                                                 *
//*         OR WHAT EVER OTHER PROGRAM YOU HAVE THAT WILL GIVE YOU  *

//***SECTION OVER SEAS TAPE SHIPPING SECTION                        *
//*       O V E R   S E A S     T A P E     S E C T I O N           *
//*******************************************************************
//*  -------------------------------------------------------------  *
//*  - ========================================================= -  *
//*  - ==                                                     == -  *
//*  - ==    PLEASE DO NOT SEND ME ANY TAPES FROM  OUTSIDE    == -  *
//*  - ==    THE UNITED STATES BY ANY MEANS OTHER THAN THE    == -  *
//*  - ==    POSTAL SERVICE OF YOUR COUNTRY .  IF YOU SHIP    == -  *
//*  - ==    THE STUFF BY AIR CARGO IT ENDS UP AT THE  AIR    == -  *
//*  - ==    PORT (BRADLEY INTERNATIONAL) IN WINDSOR LOCKS    == -  *
//*  - ==    CONNECTICUT . IT  NOT  ONLY TAKES ME ABOUT AN    == -  *
//*  - ==    ONE AND A HALF HOURS FOR A ROUND TRIP BUT  IT    == -  *
//*  - ==    ENDS UP IN BOND AND I HAVE TO MAKE AN APPOINT-   == -  *
//*  - ==    WITH US CUSTOMS TO GET IT OUT . THE LAST TIME    == -  *
//*  - ==    SOMETHING CAME THROUGH   THIS  WAY  THERE WAS    == -  *
//*  - ==    ALSO A $30.00 CHARGE FOR STORAGE OF THE  TAPE    == -  *
//*  - ==    AT THE AIR CARGO PLACE .  SO YOU CAN  SEE  IT    == -  *
//*  - ==    IS NOT WORTH IT , AT ALL . WHEN THIS  HAPPENS    == -  *
//*  - ==    I REFUSE SHIPMENT AND TELL THEM TO RETURN  IT    == -  *
//*  - ==    TO THE SHIPPER OR DESTORY THE PACKAGE .          == -  *
//*  - ==                                                     == -  *
//*  - ==    KEYWORDS POSTAL SERVICE OVERSEAS AIR FREIGHT     == -  *
//*  - ==             OVER SEAS EUROPE CANADA MEXICO          == -  *
//*  - ==             CUSTOMS REFUSE                          == -  *
//*  - ==                                                     == -  *
//*  - ========================================================= -  *
//*******************************************************************
//***SECTION THINGS TO BE DONE       SECTION                        *
//*       T H I N G   T O   BE   D O N E    S E C T I O N           *
//*******************************************************************
//*  -------------------------------------------------------------  *
//*  - ========================================================= -  *
//*  - ==                                                     == -  *
//*  - ==    IN THIS SECTION  I AM GOING TO PUT THINGS        == -  *
//*  - ==    THAT I WANT TO DO TO THIS TAPE TO ENHANCE ITS    == -  *
//*  - ==    USABILITY TO OTHERS . WILL DO THIS STUFF IF I    == -  *
//*  - ==    EVER GET THE TIME . DO NOT HOLD YOUR BREATH      == -  *
//*  - ==    WAITING HOWEVER . AS THINGS GET DONE I WILL      == -  *
//*  - ==    REMOVE THAT ITEM FROM THIS LIST                  == -  *
//*  - ==                                                     == -  *
//*  - ==     1  ADD ZAP TO ALLOW CHECKPOINT TO BE ON         == -  *
//*  - ==        A SHARED VOLUME                              == -  *
//*  - ==        NAME IGC0006C IHJACP00                       == -  *
//*  - ==        VER 05C2 4710,B7FE                           == -  *
//*  - ==        REP 05C2 4700,0707                           == -  *
//*  - ==        CHECK MICRO FICHE ON THIS FOR                == -  *
//*  - ==        PTF TAPE 7902 CARD NUMBER 85 FRAME           == -  *
//*  - ==        NUMBER D 35                       L.E. FLA   == -  *
//*  - ==     3  MARK FILES THAT ARE IN IEBUPDTE SYSIN FORMAT == -  *
//*  - ==        IF THEY CONTAIN SOURCE AND OR OBJECT OR ONLY == -  *
//*  - ==        ONE OR THE OTHER.                 S.M. STATE == -  *
//*  - ==     4  UPDATE CMD1 SO AS TO BE ABLE TO SHUT OFF     == -  *
//*  - ==        ## COMMANDS AS WE DO WITH # COMMANDS VIA     == -  *
//*  - ==        THE JCL                           S.M. STATE == -  *
//*  - ==     5  UPDATE # FOR USE UNDER CMDSBTSO SO THE WAIT  == -  *
//*  - ==        TIME AND INTERVAL ARE SHOWN ON THE HEADER    == -  *
//*  - ==        LINE - MAYBE ALSO IN AUTO UPDATE MODE        == -  *
//*  - ==        THE UPDATE COUNT IS EITHER INCREMENTED OR    == -  *
//*  - ==        DECREMENTED ON THE DISPLAY LINE ALSO         == -  *
//*  - ==                                          S.M. STATE == -  *
//*  - ==                                                     == -  *
//*  - ==                                                     == -  *
//*  - ========================================================= -  *
//*******************************************************************
//***SECTION CHANGE SECTION                                         *
//*******************************************************************
//*                                                                 *
//*           C  H  A  N  G  E      S  E  C  T  I  O  N             *
//*                                                                 *
//*******************************************************************
//*                                                                 *
//***SECTION V-249 SECTION                                          *
//*  V-249  CHANGES FOR VERSION 249 JULY 05, 1985                   *
//*                                                                 *
//*         1  UPDATE TO FILE 182 TO CONTAIN A NEW VERSION OF THE   *
//*            PDS TSO CP . VERSION 7.0                             *
//*            THE FOLLOWING IS A LIST OF THE CHANGES FOR THIS      *
//*            VERSION :                                            *
//*                                                                 *
//*       NEW SUBCOMMANDS                                           *
//*                                                                 *
//*         1.  REPLACE  -- PERFORMS CHARACTER STRING UPDATES.      *
//*         2.  SUBLIST  -- CREATES A MEMBER SUBGROUP (FOR FIND     *
//*             & IF SUBCOMMANDS).                                  *
//*         3.  VPSPRINT -- PRINTS A HARDCOPY LISTING USING THE     *
//*             TSO VPSPRINT COMMAND.                               *
//*                                                                 *
//*       CHANGES AND IMPROVEMENTS                                  *
//*                                                                 *
//*         1.  CHANGE AND PDS: ADDED THE VOLSET KEYWORD.           *
//*         2.  COMPARE: ALLOWED EITHER OLD OR NEW DATA SET         *
//*             NAMES TO REFER TO A MEMBER NAME OR A DIFFERENT      *
//*             DATA SET AND MEMBER.                                *
//*         3.  COMPRESS: ADDED IEBCOPY AUTHORIZATION VIA           *
//*             IKJEFTSR.                                           *
//*         4.  EDIT: ADDED THE PROFILE AND SETPROF KEYWORDS        *
//*             FOR ISPF V2.                                        *
//*         5.  FIND, IF, MAP, HISTORY: GENERATE A MESSAGE IF       *
//*             NO DATA IS FOUND.                                   *
//*         6.  FIXPDS: ADDED THE OPTCD AND NOOPTCD KEYWORDS.       *
//*         7.  HISTORY: ADDED COBOL COMPILE OPTIONS FOR COBOL      *
//*             LOAD MODULES.                                       *
//*         8.  IF SUBCOMMAND:                                      *
//*             A. ADDED THE HASALIAS AND NOHASALIAS KEYWORDS.      *
//*             B. ADDED A MM/DD/YY DATE FORMAT FOR THE CHANGED     *
//*                & CREATED KEYWORDS.                              *
//*         9.  ISPMODE:                                            *
//*             A. ADDED SUPPORT FOR "PROFILE NOMSGID"              *
//*             B. ADDED THE F (FIND LOG) COMMAND.                  *
//*        10.  MAP:                                                *
//*             A. ADDED DISPLAY OF UNRESOLVED AND WEAK             *
//*                UNRESOLVED EXTERNAL REFERENCES.                  *
//*             B. ADDED THE RELINK OPERAND TO GENERATE LINKAGE     *
//*                EDITOR CONTROLS & JCL.                           *
//*        11.  MEMLIST SUBCOMMAND:                                 *
//*             A. IMPROVED CURSOR POSITIONING.                     *
//*             B. IMPROVED THE ERROR STATUS MESSAGE CLEARING.      *
//*             C. ADDED ATTENTION HANDLING FOR EDIT AND BROWSE     *
//*                 LINE COMMANDS.                                  *
//*             D. ADDED LOAD MODULE LINKAGE EDIT DATES.            *
//*             E. ALLOWED FIXPDS AND COMPRESS TO USE THE LAST      *
//*                MEMBER GROUP.                                    *
//*             F. COMMAND LINE ATTRIB ADDS TO THE MEMBER LIST      *
//*                IF ANY ATTRIBUTES CHANGE.                        *
//*             G. COMMAND LINE EDIT ADDS TO THE MEMBER LIST.       *
//*        12.  RENAME: ADDED THE REPBY KEYWORD TO UPDATE TWO       *
//*             MEMBER NAMES.                                       *
//*        13.  RESTORE: MADE TTR AN OPTIONAL KEYWORD; ADDED        *
//*             FIND AND MODULE KEYWORDS.                           *
//*        14.  INSTALLATION OPTION: MODIFIED &CONDRNG.             *
//*        15.  PDS INVOKED BY ISPF V2: ALLOWED PDS TO USE ISPF     *
//*             FACILITIES EVEN IF INVOKED FROM OPTION 6 OR THE     *
//*             ISPF TSO COMMAND.                                   *
//*        16.  ATTRIB: ADDED ENTRY(NAME) OPERAND TO MODIFY THE     *
//*             ENTRY POINT.                                        *
//*        17.  DELETE: REVERSED THE ORDER OF DELETION OF GROUP     *
//*             MEMBERS.                                            *
//*        18.  OUTCOPY: ADDED AN IEBUPDTE FORMAT.                  *
//*        19.  RECALL: ADDED THE CHANGE OPERAND AND OTHER          *
//*             IMPROVEMENTS IN ISPMODE.                            *
//*        20.  MEMBERS AND DELETE: MODIFIED TO SUPPORT             *
//*             SUBLIST.                                            *
//*        21.  EXCP: ADDED A "READ MULTIPLE" LOGICAL ERROR         *
//*             TRAP MESSAGE (PDS983E).                             *
//*        22.  FIXPDS MAXSPACE: CHANGED ALL APPLICABLE STOW        *
//*             DCB'S TO USE "UPDATE" MODE SO THAT A NEW EXTENT     *
//*             WILL NOT BE TAKEN.                                  *
//*        23.  CONTROL: ADDED TRANSLATOR/NOTRANSLATOR KEYWORD      *
//*             FOR HISTORY.                                        *
//*                                                                 *
//*       PROBLEMS FIXED                                            *
//*                                                                 *
//*          1.  PDS ENTRY FROM ISPF PANEL: CORRECTED AN ABEND      *
//*              0C4 FOR TSO/E R2.1                                 *
//*          2.  LIST AND FIND: OUTPUT OF CSECT INFORMATION         *
//*              FAILED FOR LARGE MODULES.                          *
//*          3.  ISPF COMMAND TABLE ENTRY TO PDS WITH NO DATA       *
//*              SET NAME: CORRECTED AN 0C4 ABEND.                  *
//*          4.  TSOMON ABEND IN ISPF V2 AFTER CALLING PDS: PDS     *
//*              MODIFIED THE CALLER'S COMMAND BUFFER IN THE        *
//*              ORIGINAL CPPL.                                     *
//*          5.  MAP WITH ENTRY OPTION: SOMETIMES GAVE AN           *
//*              INCORRECT ENTRY NAME.                              *
//*                                                                 *
//*       ADDITIONAL INFORMATION                                    *
//*                                                                 *
//*          1.  PROGRAM COMMENTS FOLLOWING VER 7.1: ON PAGE 19     *
//*              OF A LISTING.                                      *
//*          2.  THE INFORMATION IN THE HELP MEMBER AND IN THE      *
//*              HELP PANELS.                                       *
//*                                                                 *
//*         2  UPDATE TO FILE 198 TO CONTAIN A COPY OF THE TSO      *
//*            CP CALLED PDS TO THE PREVIOUS VERSION WHICH WAS      *
//*            7.0                                                  *
//*                                                                 *
//*         3  UPDATE TO FILE 035 TO CONTAIN A COPY OF PDS VERSION  *
//*            7.1                                                  *
//*                                                                 *
//*         4  UPDATE TO FILE 296 FROM MR BRUCE LELAND OF HATACHI   *
//*            THIS HAS BEEN UPDATED TO :                           *
//*                A . COMPARE -   MODIFIED TO CHECK MEMBERS OF A   *
//*                                PDS BEFORE THE COMPARE IS DONE   *
//*                B . REVIEW  -   CHANGES TO SYNCHRONIZE WITH THE  *
//*                                HEL COMMAND. SUPPORT FOR 3278-X  *
//*                C.  RELEASE -   RELEASE COMMAND ( ORIGINAL FROM  *
//*                                THE AIRFORCE ) ADD . HAS VOLUME  *
//*                                SUPPORT                          *
//*                                                                 *
//*         5  UPDATE TO FILE 121 WHICH CONTAINS THE DOCUMENTATION  *
//*            FILE FOR THE SPLA TAPE . IT IS NOW UP TO VER 033     *
//*                                                                 *
//*         6  ADDITION OF FILE 423 FROM BROIDO COMPUTER CONSULTING *
//*            THIS FILE CONTAINS SEVERAL OF THEIR UTILITIES        *
//*                                                                 *

//*            CONTAIN AN UPDATED COPY OF HIS MACRO LIBRARY         *

//*            CONTAIN AN UPDATED COPY OF HIS GLOBAL CROSS -        *

//*                               OTHER DATA SET NAME WITHOUT       *

//*                               OPTION                            *
//*                                                                 *

//*         3  UPDATE TO FILE 161 FROM THE AIRFORCE WHICH CONTAINS  *
//*            A COPY OF THEIR ISPF/PDF CODE TO VERSION 2 DATED     *
//*            JANUARY 25, 1985                                     *
//*                                                                 *
//*         4  UPDATE TO FILE 300 FROM THE AIRFORCE TO VERSION 15.0 *
//*            JANYARY 25, 1985                                     *
//*                                                                 *
//*         5  UPDATE TO FILE 316 FROM THE AIRFORCE TO VERSION 11.0 *
//*            JANUARY 25, 1985                                     *
//*                                                                 *
//*         6  ADDITION OF FILES 453 - 455 FROM THE U.S. AIRFORCE   *
//*            IN SAN ANTONIO . THESE FILES CONTAINS :              *
//*                A. PROCEDURES FOR FREE VERSIONS OF :             *
//*                   1. PL1 F                                      *

//*                      VERSION )                                  *

//*                C. FORTRAN G & H COMPILES AND SUBROUTINE LIBRARY *
//*                                                                 *
//*         7  ADDITION OF FILE 384 FROM COMPUTER DATA SYSTEMS INC  *
//*            OF ROCKVILLE , MARYLAND . THIS FILE CONTAINS :       *
//*                A . ISPF QUE   ( SEE $$QDOC )                    *
//*                B . ISPF SPY   ( SEE ISP#QI2 )                   *
//*                C . OTHER PGMS ( SEE $$$DOC )                    *
//*                                                                 *
//*         8  UPDATE TO FILE 296 FROM MR BRUCE LELAND OF HATACHI   *
//*            THIS HAS BEEN UPDATED TO CONTAIN :                   *
//*                A . DVOL    -   MODFIED FOR MVS/XA               *
//*                B . HEL     -   MODFIED TO HANDLE 3278 MODELS    *
//*                                3 AND 4 AND 5                    *
//*                C . COMPARE -   ADDED A PDS PUTLINE INTERFACE    *
//*                                                                 *
//*         9  ADDITION OF FILE 198 WHICH IS THE PREVIOUS VERSION   *
//*            OF PDS                                               *
//*                                                                 *
//*        10  UPDATE TO FILE 182 TO CONTAIN A NEW VERSION OF THE   *
//*            PDS TSO CP . VERSION 7.0                             *
//*            THE FOLLOWING IS A LIST OF THE CHANGES FOR THIS      *
//*            VERSION :                                            *
//*                                                                 *
//*       NEW SUBCOMMAND                                            *
//*                                                                 *
//*          MEMLIST  -- INVOKES A MEMBER LIST MANAGEMENT           *
//*              INTERFACE WRITTEN BY STEVEN SMITH WITH             *
//*              SECURITY PACIFIC NATIONAL BANK IN LOS ANGELES.     *
//*                                                                 *
//*       CHANGES AND IMPROVEMENTS                                  *
//*                                                                 *
//*         1.  VERIFY: ADDED MEMBER AND MEMBER GROUP               *
//*                     VERIFICATION SUPPORT.                       *
//*         2.  IF AND FIND:                                        *
//*             A.  ADDED THEN(VERIFY) AND ELSE(VERIFY)             *
//*             B.  ADDED THEN(MEMLIST) AND ELSE(MEMLIST)           *
//*         3.  ISPMODE: ENTERED SUBCOMMANDS ARE ECHOED IN          *
//*             UPPER/LOWER CASE.                                   *
//*         4.  COMPRESS: SHOULD BE EFFECTIVE FOR ANY SIZE DATA     *
//*             SET.                                                *
//*         5.  ISPMODE: ADDED THREE OPERANDS -                     *
//*             A.  CHKMAX(NUMBER) CONTROLS THE NUMBER OF LINES     *
//*                 BETWEEN CHECKPOINTS.                            *
//*             B.  CMDMAX(NUMBER) CONTROLS THE AMOUNT OF           *
//*                 OUTPUT FROM A SUBCOMMAND.                       *
//*             C.  TBLMAX(NUMBER) CONTROLS THE SIZE OF THE         *
//*                 ISPF DIALOG TABLE.                              *
//*         6.  CONTROL:                                            *
//*             A.  RENAMED THE ABEND, CPULOOP, MSGS AND            *
//*                 OUTLOOP OPERANDS TO TESTABEND, TESTCPULOOP,     *
//*                 TESTMSGS AND TESTOUTLOOP.                       *
//*             B.  ADDED THE SYSOUT OPERAND TO PROVIDE             *
//*                 HARDCOPY LOGGING.                               *
//*             C.  ADDED THE DSNAME OPERAND TO PROVIDE DATA        *
//*                 SET LOGGING.                                    *
//*         7.  FIXPDS:                                             *
//*             A.  RENAMED THE RESETDIR OPERAND TO RESET.          *
//*             B.  ADDED SUPPORT FOR SEQUENTIAL DATA SETS.         *
//*             C.  ADDED MAXSPACE, RELEASE, RELEXTENT AND          *
//*                 RELSAVE OPERANDS.                               *
//*             D.  REDUCED THE DEFAULT BLOCKSIZES FOR 3350,        *
//*                 3375 AND 3380 DISKS.                            *
//*         8.  RECALL: ADDED SUPPORT UNDER ISPMODE AND             *
//*             MEMLIST.                                            *
//*         9.  ATTRIB AND IF: ADDED SUPPORT FOR SSI FIELD          *
//*             MANIPULATION.                                       *
//*        10.  OUTCOPY: ADDED THE TEXT OPERAND.                    *
//*        11.  TSO SUBCOMMAND:                                     *
//*             A.  CAN PROCESS CLISTS WHICH ARE EXTERNAL TO        *
//*                 PDS.                                            *
//*             B.  CAN OPTIONALLY INTERFACE TO TSOEXEC FOR         *
//*                 TSO/E RELEASE 2.                                *
//*        12.  EDIT SUBCOMMAND: RENAMED TO TSOEDIT.                *
//*        13.  SPFEDIT SUBCOMMAND:                                 *
//*             A.  RENAMED TO EDIT (WITH AN ALIAS OF SPFEDIT).     *
//*             B.  ADDED THE MACRO OPERAND FOR ISPF VERSION 2.     *
//*        14.  OPTIONS DIALOG SUPPORT: STEVE SMITH ADDED THE O     *
//*             LINE COMMAND AND THE O COMMAND TO PROVIDE PDS       *
//*             SUBCOMMAND ENTRY ASSISTANCE.                        *
//*        15.  PROGRAM ENTRY FROM ISPF: ALLOWS FOR THREE           *
//*             DIFFERENT ENTRY MODES.                              *
//*        16.  PDS200I MESSAGE: ADDED THE NUMBER OF EXTENTS IN     *
//*             THE MESSAGE.                                        *
//*        17.  PDS300A MESSAGE: ADDED A DEFAULT GROUP DISPLAY      *
//*             TO THE MESSAGE.                                     *
//*       PROBLEMS FIXED                                            *
//*          1.  3278-5 TERMINALS: ISPMODE DISPLAYS ARE LIMITED     *
//*              TO 80 BYTES.                                       *
//*          2.  IF CREATED AND CHANGED: LOAD MODULE CHECKING       *
//*              WAS INCORRECT WHEN A YEAR BOUNDARY WAS             *
//*              SPANNED.                                           *
//*       ADDITIONAL INFORMATION                                    *
//*          1.  PROGRAM COMMENTS FOLLOWING VER 7.0: ON PAGE 18     *
//*              OF A LISTING.                                      *
//*          2.  THE INFORMATION IN THE HELP MEMBER AND IN THE      *
//*              HELP PANELS.                                       *

//*                   FDR WRITE BLOCKS THAT ARE 50K LARGE OR        *
//*                   LARGER )                                      *

//*                                                                 *
//*         5  DELETION OF FILES 198 AND 199 WHICH CONTAINED AN OLD *
//*            COPY OF VTOC . REPLACED BY FILE 112                  *
//*                                                                 *
//*         6  UPDATE TO FILE 182 TO CONTAIN A NEW VERSION OF THE   *
//*            PDS TSO CP . VERSION 6.3                             *
//*            THE FOLLOWING IS A LIST OF THE CHANGES FOR THIS      *
//*            VERSION :                                            *
//*                                                                 *
//*          NEW SUBCOMMAND                                         *
//*          --------------                                         *
//*             ISPMODE  -- INVOKES AN ISPF SESSION DISPLAY         *
//*                         INTERFACE .                             *
//*          IMPROVEMENTS                                           *
//*          ------------                                           *
//*             1   VERIFY : ADDED A MAXIMUM PHYSICAL BLOCKSIZE     *
//*                 MESSAGE                                         *
//*             2   FIND : ADDED CAPS AND ASIS KEYWORDS FOR ENTERING
//*                 LOWER CASE CHARACTER DATA.                     *
//*             3   IF AND HISTORY : ADDED A SYSMOD ALIAS FOR THE   *
//*                 USER KEYWORD .                                  *
//*             4   DSNAME : REVISED THE PDS200I MESSAGE .          *
//*             5   BATCH EXECUTION : CONTROL NORECOVER IS NOW A    *
//*                 DEFAULT TO PREVENT MULTIPLE ABENDS DURING BATCH *
//*                 EXECUTION ;  IF ABEND RECOVERY IS DESIRED ;     *
//*                 CONTROL RECOVER MUST BE EXPLICITLY SPECIFIED .  *
//*             6   PDS CUSTOMIZATION : CONTROLS WERE ADDED FOR PDS *
//*                 TO INVOKE A CLIST INSTEAD OF A TSO COMMAND FOR  *
//*                 CERTAIN PDS SUBCOMMANDS .                       *
//*             7   EXIT ROUTINES : ADDED AN ACF2 SAMPLE SECURITY   *
//*                 EXIT .                                          *
//*          PROBLEMS FIXED                                         *
//*          --------------                                         *
//*             1   PROFILE NOPREFIX : CAUSED AN DATA SET ALLOCATION
//*                 S0C4 ABEND AND FILENAME ALLOCATION DID NOT WORK *
//*                 PROPERLY EITHER .                               *
//*             2   COMMAND LINE PARSE : PDS DATA.SET VOL(VOLSER)   *
//*                 SHR DID NOT WORK .                              *
//*             3   HISTORY : CERTAIN FOCUS LOAD MODULES RECEIVED   *
//*                 S0C7 ABENDS .                                   *
//*             4   SPFEDIT , BROWSE , ISPF : THE RETURN KEY ( OR   *
//*                 EXTENDED RETURN) CAUSED SUBSEQUENT SPFEDIT ,    *
//*                 BROWSE OR ISPF SUBCOMMANDS TO EXIT PREMATURELY  *
//*                 THEY ARE NOW REINVOKED TO RESET RETURN          *
//*                 PROCESSING .                                    *
//*             5   PDS INVOKED UNDER EDIT : THE SPFEDIT SUBCOMMAND *
//*                 DID NOT WORK .                                  *
//*             6   ATTENTION EXIT :                                *
//*                 A   ADDED TCLEARQ INPUT TO SYNCRONIZE TERMINAL  *
//*                     INPUTS.                                     *
//*                 B   ADDED STATUS STOP TO TERMINATE ANY          *
//*                     SUBTASKS .                                  *
//*                 C   ADDED GETPUT TERM TO DISALLOW PROMPT INPUT  *
//*                     FROM A CLIST .                              *
//*                 D   ADDED STACK DELETE TO TERMINATE ANY CURRENT *
//*                     CLIST .                                     *
//*             7   ESTAE EXIT : ADDED STACK DELETE TO TERMINATE ANY
//*                 CURRENT CLIST .                                 *
//*             8   COMPRESS SB37 ABEND : ADDED A PDS GENERATION    *
//*                 CONTROL TO SPECIFY THE MAXIMUM NUMBER OF        *
//*                 MEMBERS IN A DATA SET TO BE COMPRESSED .        *
//*             9   ISPF RESERVE/DEQ NAME : CHANGED THE MAJOR NAME  *
//*                 FROM SPFDSN TO SPFEDIT AS IN PTF UZ65671 .      *
//*            10   SESSION MANAGER :                               *
//*                 A   PDS ENTRY PANEL : OBTAINED AN S0C4 ABEND    *
//*                 B   SPFEDIT AND BROWSE : TURNED OFF SESSION     *
//*                     MANAGER                                     *
//*                 C   RESTORE WITH PROMPT : REQUIRED DOUBLE YES/NO
//*                     PROMPTING                                   *
//*                 D   KLEAR : CAUSED ERRONEOUS INVALID SUBCOMMAND *
//*                    MESSAGES                                     *
//*                                                                 *

//*           ----------------                                      *
//*              1   COMPARE  -- INVOKES THE TSO COMPARE COMMAND    *

//*            TAPE - HAVE RETAINED THE LASTEST 2 VERSIONS IN       *
//*            FILES 407 AND 335                                    *

//*         4  EVERY OCCURANCE OF HARTFORD NATIONAL BANK HAS BEEN   *
//*            CHANGED TO CONNECTICUT NATIONAL BANK IN THIS FILE    *
//*                                                                 *
//*         5  REMOVE THE TSO CP CALLED PDS FROM FILE 300 SO AS NOT *
//*            TO HAVE MULTIPLE COPIES ON THIS TAPE                 *
//*                                                                 *
//*         6  UPDATE TO FILE 182 TO CONTAIN A NEW VERSION OF THE   *
//*            PDS TSO CP . VERSION 6.1                             *
//*            THE FOLLOWING IS A LIST OF THE CHANGES FOR THIS      *
//*            VERSION :                                            *
//*                                                                 *
//*          NEW SUBCOMMANDS :                                      *
//*          ----------------                                       *
//*             1   CONTROL -- SPECIFIES PDS PROCESSING OPTIONS.    *
//*             2   REVIEW  -- INVOKES THE TSO REVIEW COMMAND.      *
//*          IMPROVEMENTS :                                         *
//*          -------------                                          *
//*             1   INPUT BUFFERING : DOUBLE BUFFERING IS USED      *
//*                 WHEREVER POSSIBLE                               *
//*             2   FIND AND LIST :                                 *
//*                 A   ADDED SUPPORT FOR OUTPUT OF CSECT           *
//*                     INFORMATION                                 *
//*                 B   CHANGED LOAD MODULE DEFAULT OUTPUT FORMAT   *
//*                     TO LDUMP                                    *
//*                 C   ADDED MODULE AND OFFSET KEYWORDS            *
//*                 D   ADDED A SECOND OUTPUT DISPLACEMENT FIELD    *
//*             3   RESTORE :                                       *
//*                 A   CHANGED RESTORE SCAN TO ALSO CONSIDER THE   *
//*                     PROVIDED TTR ADDRESS AS THE ADDRESS OF A    *
//*                     DELETED MEMBER                              *
//*                 B   ADDED THE LIKE KEYWORD                      *
//*             4   DELETE : REWROTE TO TAKE ADVANTAGE OF DOUBLE    *
//*                          BUFFERING                              *
//*             5   DISPLAY AND PATTERN : ADDED MEMBER GROUP SYNTAX *
//*             6   IF : ADDED APFERR AND NOAPFERR KEYWORDS         *
//*             7   VERIFY : ADDED UPDATE AND NOUPDATE KEYWORDS     *
//*             9   FIXPDS : BLOCKSIZE VALUES FOR DATA KEYWORDS SUCH
//*                 AS ASM , CLIST , CNTL , LOAD OR OBJECT ARE      *
//*                 BASED ON THE DEVICE TYPE                        *
//*          PROBLEMS FIXED :                                       *
//*          ---------------                                        *
//*             1   PDS DIALOG ENTRY TO PDS : THE ACTUAL ECT IS NOW *
//*                 LOCATED                                         *
//*             2   TSO SERVICE ROUTINE ADDRESSES : LOAD AND DELETES
//*                 ARE PERFORMED FOR ANY SERVICE ROUTINE ADDRESSES *
//*                 NOT LOCATED IN THE CVT                          *
//*             3   TSO : THE TIME OPERAND IS NOW SUPPORTED         *
//*             4   EDIT , FSE , PRINTOFF , REVIEW , SUBMIT AND     *
//*                 TSOLIST  : PDS CHECKS FOR VALID MEMBER NAMES    *
//*                 BEFORE LINKING TO THE COMMAND PROCESSOR         *
//*             5   IF : AUTHORIZED MODULE CHECKING WAS INCORRECT   *
//*                 ( THE APF LENGTH FIELD WAS NOT CHECKED          *
//*                 PROPERLY )                                      *
//*          ADDITIONAL INFORMATION :                               *
//*          -----------------------                                *
//*             1   PROGRAM COMMENTS FOLLOWING VER 6.1 : ON PAGE 14 *
//*                 OF A LISTING                                    *
//*             2   THE HELP MEMBER                                 *
//*                                                                 *
//*         7  DELETION OF FILE 115 WHICH WAS OBSOLETE              *
//*                                                                 *
//*         8  ADDITION OF FILE 115 FROM L.L. BEAN WHICH CONTAINS   *
//*            A COPY OF THEIR CODE TO ALLOW PASSWORDS IN JCL       *
//*                                                                 *
//*         9  UPDATE TO FILE 320 WHICH IS A SERIES OF DF/DSS       *
//*            DRIVER EXITS FROM LOMA LINDA UNIVERSITY MED CENTER . *
//*                                                                 *

//***SECTION V-210 SECTION                                          *
//*  V-210  CHANGES FOR VERSION 210 JANUARY 23, 1983                *
//*                                                                 *
//*         1  UPDATE TO FILE 266 WHICH IS THE # CMD1 SUBSYSTEM     *
//*            TO CONTAIN THE FOLLOWING COMMENTS ABOUT RUNNING CMD1 *
//*            IN A JES3 ENVIRONMENT :                              *
//*                                                                 *
//*            THERE IS A PROBLEM UNDER JES3 WHEN A #T              *
//*            OR A #D ( INTO SOMEONES ADDRESS SPACE ) IS           *
//*            ISSUED . THE JES3 CONSOLES LOSE ROLL                 *
//*            MODE .                                               *
//*            IT APPEARS THAT THESE TWO COMMANDS ARE               *
//*            EXECUTED IN THE JES3 ADDRESS SPACE . SO              *
//*            FAR SO GOOD , HOWEVER THESE COMMANDS                 *
//*            ISSUE OS / MACROS ( EXAMPLE STIMER ) WHICH           *
//*            ARE ILLEGAL UNDER THE JES3 ADDRESS                   *
//*            SPACE .                                              *
//*            ILLEGAL OS / MACROS ARE DOCUMENTED IN A              *
//*            JES3 MANUAL ( I DO NOT KNOW THE MANUAL               *
//*            NAME OR NUMBER - IF AND WHEN I FIND OUT              *
//*            I WILL DOCUMENT IT HERE ) .                          *
//*                                                                 *
//*         2  UPDATE TO FILE 300 TO RELEASE 9.0  OF TSO COMMANDS   *

//*            VARIABLE DEPENDING UPON WHETHER OR NOT SUPERCEDED    *
//*            ENTRIES ARE BEING DISPLAYED; INSTEAD , A  ' *MORE* ' *

//***SECTION V-176 SECTION                                          *
//*  V-176  CHANGES FOR VERSION 176 AUGUST 11, 1981                 *
//*                                                                 *
//*         1  UPDATE TO FILES 266 AND 267 TO CORRECT THE PROBLEM   *
//*            REFERRED TO IN VERSION 175 OF THIS TAPE              *
//*                                                                 *
//*            A  THE FOLLOWING MODULES OF THE # COMMAND SUBSYSTEM  *
//*               HAVE BEEN MODIFIED TO CHANGE THE WAY ESTAE        *
//*               PROCESSING IS HANDLED                             *
//*                                                                 *
//*              CSCGF03D NSEGF03D SE2GF03D SP1GF03D   FRAME GRAPH  *
//*              CSCGH03D                              HELP  GRAPH  *
//*              CSCSE03D NSESE03D SE2SE03D            # A          *
//*              CSCSK03D SE2SK03D                     # C          *
//*              CSCSD03D SE2SD03D                     # D          *
//*              CSCSS03D                              # E          *
//*              CSCSF03D SE2SF03D                     # F          *
//*              CSCSM03D                              # H          *
//*              CSCSJ03D NSESJ03D SE2#IOLD SE2SJ03D   # I          *
//*              CSCSL03D NSESL03D                     # J          *
//*              CSCSC03D                              # L          *
//*              CSCSO03D                              # M          *
//*              CSCSA03D                              # N 1ST LOD  *
//*              CSCSB03D                              # N 2ND LOD  *
//*              CSCSR03D SE2SR03D                     # O          *
//*              CSCSP03D                              # P          *
//*              CSCSQ03D                              # Q          *
//*              CSCSG03D                              # R          *
//*              CSCSH03D                              # S          *
//*              CSCSN03D                              # T          *
//*              CSCSI03D                              # V          *
//*              CSCZB03D                              ##B          *
//*              NSEZJ03D                              ##J          *
//*                                                                 *
//*     NOTE :                                                      *
//*            1  NSE***** ARE THE NON-MVS/SE-SP    VERSIONS        *
//*            1  SE2***** ARE THE MVS/SE RELEASE 2 VERSIONS        *
//*            1  SP1***** ARE THE MVS/SP RELEASE 1 VERSIONS        *
//*                                                                 *
//*            B  #DXX,00 IS FIXED SO IT WILL NOT LOOP AND          *
//*               POSSIBILY PUT THE OPERATING SYSTEM INTO A         *
//*               SOLID WAIT                                        *
//*                                                                 *
//*            C  ADDED THE ' C ' SUBCOMMAND TO THE MVS/SP1 VERSION *
//*               OF #I                                             *
//*                                                                 *
//*         2  UPDATE TO FILE 145 FROM LOMA LINDA TO ADD A VERSION  *
//*            OF THE FENCING ZAP TO AN 8104 LEVEL                  *
//*                                                                 *
//***SECTION V-175 SECTION                                          *
//*  V-175  CHANGES FOR VERSION 175 JULY 19, 1981                   *
//*                                                                 *
//*          ************************************************       *
//*          *                                              *       *
//*          * THE FOLLOWING IS FOR INFORMATION ONLY AS THE *       *
//*          * CODE HAS BEEN MODIFIED SO THE FOLLOWING WILL *       *
//*          * NO LONGER OCCUR ( ASSUMING YOU ARE RUNING    *       *
//*          * THE CODE FROM TAPE 175+ OR LATER )           *       *
//*          *                                              *       *
//*          ************************************************       *
//*                                                                 *
//*         1  UPDATE TO FILE 266 WHICH IS THE # CMD1 SUBSYSTEM     *
//*            TO ADD THE FOLLOWING INFORMATION                     *
//*                                                                 *
//*                            ##   ##                              *
//*                            ##   ##                              *
//*                            ##   ##                              *
//*                         #############                           *
//*    ALSO NEED APAR       #############                           *
//*    AZ55724 WITH THE        ##   ##                              *
//*    BELOW MENTIONED         ##   ##                              *
//*    PTF'S AS THEY HAVE   #############                           *
//*    A PE AGAINST THEM    #############                           *
//*    (FIX IS IN RETAIN)      ##   ##                              *
//*                            ##   ##                              *
//*                            ##   ##                              *
//*                                                                 *
//*              THERE SS A VERY SERIOUS PROBLEM WITH THE USE       *
//*              OF THE # COMMAND SUBSYSTEM ( CMD1 ) AND A PTF      *
//*              ON PUT TAPE 8105 .  WHEN CMD1 IS USED ON A         *
//*              SYSTEM THAT HAS PTF UZ35143 , OR UZ35144 , OR      *
//*              UZ35145 APPLIED YOU WILL BE PLACED IN THE          *
//*              SITUATION WHERE YOU WILL HAVE TO IPL !!!!          *
//*              YOUR SYSTEM WILL GO INTO A LOOP AND ALL YOUR       *
//*              WQE ' S WILL BE  FILLED WITH AN  ' ERROR           *
//*              ENCOUNTED IN IN CONTROL BLOCKS , RETRY             *
//*              COMMAND ' MESSAGE . SOME SOLUTIONS TO THIS         *
//*              ARE :                                              *
//*                        1  DO NOT RUN CMD1                       *
//*                        2  DO NOT PUT THE PTF ON                 *
//*                        3  REMOVE ALL THE ESTAE ' S FROM CMD1    *
//*                        4  CORRECT ALL THE ESTAE CODING          *
//*              THE PTF CHANGED MODULE IEE0003D AND THE            *
//*              MODULE NOW USES THE FAST ESTAE PATH  AND           *
//*              BECAUSE  OF THE WAY  ESTAE IS IMPLEMENTED IN       *
//*              CMD1 THERE IS A PROBLEM .  WE HAVE FIXED ALL THE   *
//*              ESTAES ON LATER VERSIONS OF THIS TAPE SO THEY      *
//*              WORK CORRECTLY , IF YOU DO NOT WANT THIS CODE      *
//*                                THE QUICKEST AND FASTEST         *
//*              SOLUTION IS TO REMOVE  ALL THE ESATES .            *
//*              OBVIOUSLY IF YOU DO THIS AND CMD1 ABENDS YOU       *
//*              WILL GET AN SVC DUMP ( C0D ) INTO ONE OF YOUR      *
//*              SYS1.DUMP DATA SETS                                *
//*                                                                 *
//*  V-174  CHANGES FOR VERSION 174 JUNE 25, 1981                   *

//***SECTION V-115 SECTION                                          *
//*  V-115  CHANGES FOR VERSION 115 MARCH 11, 1979                  *
//*                                                                 *
//*         1  UPDATE TO FILE 252 TO INCREASE THE SIZE OF THE       *
//*            NAMETABLE , SO AS TO AVOID A POSSIBLE OC4            *
//*                                                                 *
//*         2  TO ADD A COMMENT CONCERNING FILE 260 WHICH IS THE    *
//*            QUICK MAP PROGRAM . A USER OF THIS CODE DECIDED      *
//*            TO USE A PARM OF RESET , WHICH WILL RESET THE HIGH   *
//*            WATER MARK IN THE VTOC . IT DID ALRIGHT BUT IT SET   *
//*            IT TO 512 ( ON A 3350 ) AND THE ARM BOUNCED ALL OVER *
//*            THE PLACE . BE CAREFUL !!!!!                         *
//*                                                                 *
//*         3. CHANGED FILE 261 ( SMF BUFFER ZAP ) TO BE IN SMP     *
//*            FORMAT ( MORE OR LESS - HAVE TO CHANGE ALL ' , S TO  *
//*            + ' S BECAUSE WE USE PANVALET TO STORE IT )          *

//*                                                                 *
//*         1  ADDITION OF FILE 202 WHICH IS THE EXTENDED JES2      *
//*            AUTOMATIC COMMAND PROCESSING , RELEASE 2 , MARCH     *

//*            THE TIME-OF-DAY PROCESSING SUPPORTED BY JES2 AND     *

//*                                                                 *
//*         2  ADDITIONAL NOTE FOR SQUISH WHICH IS IN FILE 192 ON   *
//*            THIS TAPE . 3350 ' S CAN HAVE 47 DSCB ' S PER TRACK ,
//*            IF YOU NOTICE THAF YOUR PACKS HAVE ONLY 46 DSCB'S  *
//*            PER TRACK YOU ARE MISSING PTF UZ14352 . SQUISH MAY   *
//*            VERY WELL BLOW WHEN YOU TRY TO WRITE THE 47TH DSCB   *
//*            IF THE PTF IS NOT ON                                 *
//*                                                                 *
//*         3  SEE ADDITIONAL INFORMATION UNDER FILE 172 WHICH IS   *
//*            VERSION 1.1 , JANUARY 1978 OF OURMF                  *
//*                                                                 *

//***SECTION V-081 SECTION                                          *
//*  V-081  CHANGES FOR VERSION 81 FEBRUARY 1, 1978                 *
//*                                                                 *
//*         1   MODIFICATION TO FILE 179, WHICH IS AN RMF POST      *
//*             PROCESSOR TO HARD CODE BFTEK=A IN THE DCB FOR       *
//*             THE INPUT SMF FILE . BYPASS FOR APAR OZ21111 .      *
//*                          IN/INCORROUT IFG019RJ - JFCB - DCB     *
//*             MERGE OF BFTEK=A FOR VBS RECORDS BAD .              *
//*             WHEN REQUESTING VBS , SMF DATASET , TO BE IN QSAM   *
//*             LOCATE MODE FOR SPANNED RECORDS , VIA JCL .         *
//*             JFCB+X'59' HAS CORRECT VALUE , DCB BFTEK IS         *
//*             INCORRECT . WILL WORK WHEN DCB IN PROGRAM HAS       *
//*             BFTEK=A HARDCODED IN . CORRECTED BY UZ13299         *
//*                                                                 *
//*         2   MODIFICATION TO FILE 190 , WHICH IS AN RMF POST     *
//*             PROCESSOR TO HARD CODE BFTEK=A IN THE DCB FOR       *
//*             THE INPUT SMF FILE . BYPASS FOR APAR OZ21111 .      *
//*                          IN/INCORROUT IFG019RJ - JFCB - DCB     *
//*             MERGE OF BFTEK=A FOR VBS RECORDS BAD .              *
//*             WHEN REQUESTING VBS , SMF DATASET , TO BE IN QSAM   *
//*             LOCATE MODE FOR SPANNED RECORDS , VIA JCL .         *
//*             JFCB+X'59' HAS CORRECT VALUE , DCB BFTEK IS         *
//*             INCORRECT . WILL WORK WHEN DCB IN PROGRAM HAS       *
//*             BFTEK=A HARDCODED IN . CORRECTED BY UZ13299         *
//*                                                                 *
//*         3   UPDATE OF FILE 172 TO VERSION 1.1 JANUARY 1978      *

//* INDIRECTLY  CAUSED BY  THE USE OF THESE MODS.   IT IS THE USERS *
//* RESPONSIBILITY  TO  EVALUATE THE  USEFULLNESS  OF THE  MATERIAL *
//* SUPPLIED.                                                       *

//* WE DO NOT GUARANTEE TO  KEEP ANY  MATERIAL PROVIDED  UP TO DATE *
//* NOR DO WE GUARANTEE TO  PROVIDE ANY  CORRECTIONS OR  EXTENSIONS *

//*                                                                 *
//***SECTION FILE STATUS SECTION                                    *
//*******************************************************************
//*                                                                 *
//*            F I L E    S T A T U S    S E C T I O N              *
//*                                                                 *
//*******************************************************************
//*                                                                 *
//*  THE COLUMN 3.7 SHOWS STATUS WITH MVS 3.7. THE CODES MEAN ,     *
//*                                                                 *
//*        3.8  =  IT HAS BEEN RUN UNDER 3.8 SOMEWHERE NOT AT CBT   *
//*        YES  =  IT HAS BEEN RUN UNDER 3.7 OKAY WITH SU 5 & 7     *
//*        NO   =  IT WILL NOT RUN UNDER 3.7                        *
//*        UNK  =  HAS NOT BEEN TESTED UNDER 3.7                    *
//*        N/A  =  NOT SYSTEM DEPENDENT (NO REASON NOT TO RUN)      *
//*     DELETED =  DELETED FROM THIS TAPE                           *
//*        SU'S =  SU5 & SU7                                        *
//*        SE2  =  MVS/SE2 RELEASE 1                                *
//*        SE22 =  MVS/SE2 RELEASE 2                                *
//*        SP11 =  MVS/SP  RELEASE 1.1                              *
//*        SP12 =  MVS/SP  RELEASE 1.2                              *
//*        SP13 =  MVS/SP1.3 RELEASE                                *
//*        X A  =  MVS/ X A RELEASE                                 *
//*      UNKCBT =  NOT TESTED AT CBT                                *
//*      MVS/SE =  SPECIFICALLY FOR MVS/SE                          *
//*         ALL =  ONLY THE SOURCE FOR # COMMAND SYSTEM HAS THIS    *
//*                THIS MARKER BECAUSE THERE IS SOURCE FOR :        *
//*                  01  NON-SE ( BASE 3.8 - 3.7 WITH SU5 AND SU7 ) *
//*                  02  SE/RELEASE 1                               *
//*                  03  SE/RELEASE 2                               *
//*                  04  SP/RELEASE 1                               *
//*                 SOME OF THE COMMANDS ARE ONLY SUPPORTED ON      *
//*                 CERTAIN RELEASES WHILE OTHERS ARE SUPPORTED ON  *
//*                 ALL RELEASES                                    *
//*        CBT  =  RELEASE 6.0 OF IPO WITH THE FOLLOWING SU ' S AND *
//*                8304:   ( MVS 3.8 )    MVS 3.8 SP/1.3            *
//*                                                                 *
//*                      01 02 03 04 05 06 07 08 09 10       13     *
//*                      15 16 17    19 20 21 22 23 24 25    27     *
//*                      29 30    32 33 34 35 36 37    39 40        *
//*                            45    47 48    50 51 52 53 54 55     *
//*                      57 58    60 61    63 64 65       68        *
//*                               74                                *
//*                                                    95 96        *
//*                                                                 *
//*                                                                 *
//*      COMPRESSED HEADER SHOWS IF THE FILE HAS BEEN COMPRESSED    *
//*                                                                 *
//*                                                                 *
//*                                                                 *
//*                 FILE 3.7    RECORD FOOT            ORIGINAL     *
//*                 NUM-         COUNT AGE   AS OF         LRECL    *
//*                 BER                6                            *
//*                                     2                      COM  *
//*                                      5                     PRES *
//*                                       0                    SED? *
//*                                     BPI                         *
//* |            DO NOT REMOVE THIS LINE FOR QUICK INDEX PGM        *
//* |JCL CREAT       001 N/A    23386   26.4 07-05-85      080    NO* %
//* COMPRESS         002 CBT      260     .3 04-01-79      080    NO*
//* DROP TAPE        003 CBT     1549    1.9 07-05-85      080    NO*
//* INFOTAPE         004 CBT     1414     .4 06-20-82      080 YES  *
//* INFOTAPE         005 CBT       20     .0 06-14-82      255    NO*
//* FREEALL          006 CBT      140     .1 10-16-76      080 YES  *
//* IEFACTRT         007 CBT      485     .3 10-16-76      080 YES  *
//* DELETE LIST      008 N/A      234     .2 04-04-82      080 YES  *
//* SYNSCORT EXIT    009 UNKCBT    95     .1 05-28-84      080 YES  *
//* GPSAM DOC        010 UNKCBT  1522    1.4 12-05-82      080 YES  *
//* GPSAM SRC        011 UNKCBT  2047    1.4 12-05-82      080 YES  *
//* ISPF DIAG        012 UNCBT   6366    3.7 03-24-85      080 YES  *
//* IO CONFIG        013 CBT     1179     .9 08-27-80      080 YES  *
//* GRUM UTIL        014 CBT     1079     .9 08-27-80      080 YES  *
//* STATE CP         015 CBT      184     .2 08-27-80      080 YES  *
//* SMPCOVER         016 CBT     1956    1.4 10-28-80      080 YES  *
//* UTILITIES        017 UNKCBT  5176    3.2 09-01-80      080 YES  *
//* TSUPDATE         018 CBT      910    1.9 04-21-85      133    NO*
//* VTAM             019 UNKCBT  9016    6.0 07-17-83      080 YES  *
//* SCRPIT CP        020 UNKCBT  2149    1.4 09-14-80      080 YES  *
//* DMS JCL          021 UNKCBT   178     .1 01-03-82      080 YES  *
//* DMS DOC          022 UNKCBT  1684    1.4 01-03-82      080 YES  *
//* DMS SRC  NOSE    023 UNKCBT 20866   13.9 01-03-82      080 YES  *
//* DMS LOAD NOSE    024 UNKCBT    57   11.2 01-03-82    IEBCOPY  NO*
//* DMS SRC  SE      025 UNKCBT 14054    8.8 01-03-82      080 YES  *
//* DMS LOAD SE      026 UNKCBT    57   11.2 01-03-82    IEBCOPY  NO*
//* MTRACE           027 UNKCBT   307     .2 08-24-80      080 YES  *
//* DLIBXREF         028 N/A      303     .2 04-19-77      080 YES  *
//* DLIBXREF         029 N/A      235     .2 10-16-76      080 YES  *
//* FREEALL          030 CBT      228     .1 03-20-80      080 YES  *
//* FREEALL          031 CBT      228     .1 03-20-80      080 YES  *
//* NCCFACF2         032 UNKCBT  4308    2.3 06-11-85      080 YES  *
//* IEECVXIT         033 UNKCBT   892     .9 03-14-83      080 YES  *

//***SECTION OFFLOAD SECTION                                        *
//*******************************************************************
//*                                                                 *
//*              O F F L O A D           S E C T I O  N             *
//*                                                                 *
//*******************************************************************
//*                                                                 *
//*    SEVERAL FILES ON THIS  TAPE ARE  CREATED BY  USING THE YALE  *
//*    OFFLOAD PROGRAM (FILE 225). WHEN THE  OFFLOAD PROGRAM FINDS  *
//*    DATA RECORDS IN A PDS THAT LOOK LIKE IEBUPDTE CONTROL CARDS  *
//*    ( IE . './' ) IT SUBSTITUES A >< FOR AN ' ./ ' .            *
//*                                                                 *
//*******************************************************************
//*                OFFLOAD FORMAT ---- ( ERGO ' ./ '                *
//*                CONTROL CARDS HAVE BEEN CONVERTED TO ' >< '      *
//*                AND YOU WILL HAVE TO ISSUE A GLOBAL CHANGE TO    *
//*                CONVERT >< TO ./ BEFORE YOU USE THESE MEMBER AS  *
//*                SYSIN INPUT TO IEBUPDTE .                        *
//*                                                                 *
//*   *** FIRST TAKE THE WHOLE FILE AND IEBUPDTE IT TO A DATASET    *
//*       THEN EDIT EACH OF THE FOLLOWING MEMBERS AND DO YOUR       *
//*       GLOBAL CHANGE BEFORE YOU DO ANOTHER IEBUPDTE RUN FOR      *
//*       EACH OF THE FOLLOWING TO ITS OWN UNIQUE PDS . ***         *
//*                                                                 *
//*    THE FOLLOWING FILES ARE IN IEBUPDTE SYSIN FORMAT AND MAY     *
//*    HAVE BEEN ACCESSED BY OFFLOAD AT ONE TIME OR ANOTHER AND     *
//*    HENCE MAY HAVE >< SUBSTITUED FOR AN ./                       *

//*******************************************************************
//*                                                                 *
//* IN THIS SECTION I WILL ATTEMPT TO DOCUMENT ALL THE TSO QUE      *
//* COMMANDS THAT ARE BURIED IN VARIOUS PLACES ON THIS TAPE         *
//*                                                                 *
//* ** I KNOW I DO NOT HAVE ALL OF THEM DOCUMENTED YET - WHEN I  ** *
//* ** THINK I  DO I WILL REMOVE THIS TWO LINE COMMENT, ARNIE    ** *
//*                                                                 *
//* ** IF A VERSION OF QUE WILL RUN WITH JES2 1.3.3 IT WILL BE      *
//* ** NOTED THAT IS DOES - IF NOT , NO COMMENT TO THE CONTRARY     *
//*                                                                 *
//* FILE  LEVEL             COMPANY AND DOCUMENTATION               *
//*                                                                 *
//* 148   JES2 1.3.0        ANR FROM HOUTSON, TEXAS . THIS IS FOR   *
//*                         JES2 1.3.0  . THIS VERSION USES EXCP    *
//*                                                                 *
//* 352   JES2 1.3.0        INTEL FROM SAN JOSE , CALIFORNIA . THIS *
//*                         VERSION OF QUE HAS THE LANE BRYANT MODS *
//*                         INCORPORATED INTO IT                    *
//*                                                                 *
//* 390   JES2 1.3.3        ANR FROM HOUSTON, TEXAS THIS IS THE 1ST *
//*                         VERSION I RECEIVED THAT WILL RUN UNDER  *
//*                         JES2.1.3.3 . THIS VERSION USES EXCP     *
//*                                                                 *
//* 391   JES2 1.3.0        OAK RIDGE NATIONAL LABORATORY FROM      *
//*                         OAK RIDGE , TENN . THIS VERSION HAS ALL *
//*                         THE SECURITY CHECKS MOVED TO A NEW      *
//*                         AND SEPARATE CSECT                      *

//***SECTION PUT TAPE CHANGES                                       *
//*******************************************************************
//*                                                                 *
//*              P U T - T A P E    C H A N G E S                   *
//*                                                                 *
//*******************************************************************
//*                                                                 *
//*    THE FOLLOWING PUT TAPES HAD THE FOLLOWING EFFECTS . ( EITHER *
//*     WE AT CBT HAD THE PROBLEM OR SOMEONE ELSE DID AND TOLD US ) *
//*                                                                 *
//*    PUT 8105 - AFTER THE INSTALL OF UZ35143  UZ35144  OR UZ35145 *
//*               YOU WILL LOSE YOUR SYSTEM IF YOU TRY TO ISSUE     *
//*               CERTAIN # ( CMD1 ) COMMANDS . THE CIRCUMVENTION IS
//*               NOT TO APPLY THE ABOVE PTFS . IF YOU HAVE HOWEVER *
//*               THE PE CORRECTION IS AZ55724 . THE BEST THING TO  *
//*               DO IS USE THE CORRECT VERSION OF THE CMD1 CODE    *
//*               WHICH IS CURRENTLY ON THIS TAPE .                 *
//*                                                                 *
//*    PUT 8107 - AFTER THE INSTALL OF THE JES2 LEVEL SET ON THIS   *
//*               TAPE YOU MAY FIND THE THE XI COMMAND OF QUE DOES  *
//*               NOT WORK . THE CORRECTION IS TO RE-COMPILE QUE .  *
//*                                                                 *
//*                                                                 *
//*    PUT8107-8111-AFTER THIS INSTALL WITH PTF UZ32172 ( OZ51339 ) *
//*               THE ATTACHING OF THE TMP ( IKJEFT01 ) UNDER THE   *
//*               TMP NO LONGER WORKS CORRECTLY                     *
